you can start with sudo apt-get install build-essential
the compiler for c is called gcc and is included in that package. you can also use the c++ compiler (g++) to compile c code
i would recommend starting with c++, there are more current tutorials available - see cplusplus.com
you have already been told to start with: sudo apt-get install build-essential
then you have gcc available to you. that is the compiler, now you have to find a c and/or c++ tutorial on the web
i wrote gcc and it gave me "gcc: no input files"
the syntax is: gcc <yourfile.c> -o <yourexecutablename>, but as i said, find a tutorial on the internets - there are many available
